remarks: A set that contains the greatest element satisfies the antecedent in supremum theorems.  This allows ` sup ( A , B , R ) ` to be used in some situations without the completeness axiom.  (Contributed by Jeff Hoffman, 17-Jun-2008.)  Obsolete as of 30-Mar-2020. (New usage is discouraged.)  (Proof modification is discouraged.)
statement:
supmaxlemOLD $p |- ( ( C e. A /\ C e. B /\ A. z e. B -. C R z ) -> E. x e. A ( A. y e. B -. x R y /\ A. y e. A ( y R x -> E. z e. B y R z ) ) ) $.
$d A x $.
$d B x y z $.
$d C x y z $.
$d R x y z $.
